result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry M. Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Restitution remaining after revocation of the Defendant's probation.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Serve 9 months jail as conditional time, with work release, and stayed until on or before October 30, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

No contact with David Bannister or Jodie Post.

Comply with counseling and any other treatment as directed by the agent.

Pay court costs as a condition of probation.

Pay $300 restitution to David Bannister as a condition of probation with restitution ordered paid in full within 1 year of 8/31/16.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With work release and stayed until on or before October 30, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Dodge Correctional as reception center. Def to be eligible for any/all treatment programming.360 days credit by stipulation.

Restitution for the victim is to be collected by the Department of Corrections as a condition of Extended Supervision. Once case is resolved, Crawford Cty will dismiss 18CF66. Court costs will continue to be a condition of extended supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry M. Campbell in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have a joint agreement: 18mo of initial confinement/12mo ES. Crawford Cty 18CF66 the restitution in the amount of $1524.31 will be made a condition of ES and Atty Baxter will dismiss Crawford's case. 360 days credit. 

Court orders:
Count 1: 30 months total sentence in the WI prison system with 18 months as initial confinement and 12 months as extended supervision. Dodge Correctional as reception center. Def to be eligible for any/all treatment programming. $1524.31 of restitition to MS ordered as a condition of extended supervision, once this case is resolved, Crawford Cty will dismiss 18CF66. Court costs will continue to be a condition of extended supervision. 360 days credit by stipulation.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 14, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jerry M. Campbell in court, in person, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper asks for a setover.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 14, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 29, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Clerk is waiting for confirmation from the parties before tentatiely setting SEHR for 8/29 at 9:30. 

8/13/18 - DA's office and Atty. McDougal have both confirmed availability 8/29 at 9:30. Clerk has notified the agent of the date/time as well.

Clerk has informed DA's office, SPD, and Richland County Sheriff's Dept. of Mr. Campbell's revocation. His agent believes him to be presently in the Crawford County Jail. Once the clerk knows who will represent him, sentencing after revocation will be set.

Defendant Jerry M. Campbell in court with attorney Lui Moefu. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  PSI noted.  Counsel and Def address the Court.  3 years probation with conditions - 9 months jail, no contact with DB or JP, comply with counseling and any other treatment as directed by agent, pay costs, pay DB $300 restitution.  Defense requests stay of jail.  Court gives def 60 days to begin jail time; allowing def this time for employment purpose.  Court orders def to pay the restitution within 1 year.  Firearms admonishment.

Defendant Jerry M. Campbell in court with attorney Lui Moefu. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jerry M. Campbell in court/in custody with attorney Lui Moefu. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Moefu waives formal reading of the complaint, enters NG pleas. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-10-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Jerry M. Campbell appeared by phone means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody on a P/P hold and without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court questions def as to whether he has counsel.  Def states he hasn't called SPD yet.  Def not presently working.  Court instructs def to contact SPD; jail staff to make sure he makes the call.  This matter adjourned to tomorrow at 2:30, again directling def to contact SPD so that he might have counsel at that time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
